Html:
Hi,

I am trying to use the control. Specifically the "GetRoute" functionality as in the following snippet:
        PointLatLng start = new PointLatLng(29.1878, 82.1306);      //Ocala, Fl
        PointLatLng end = new PointLatLng(29.6520, 82.3250);        //Gainsville, FL
        MapRoute route = GMapProviders.GoogleMap.GetRoute(start, end, false, false, 15);
The route returns null and I have tried dozens of "providers" with the same result. Searching on the topic yields a paucity of results at least four years old leading me to think this is a dead control and I need to look elsewhere in order to obtain a route between two US cities. Am I missing something?
that's Nepal dude ;} ..and there aren't many roads or cities
Great answer. Yes, the longitude values should be negative but that doesn't change the fact the getroute functions don't work.
unfortunately i can't test it right now, in the mean time you can try debug it yourself, make sure you use latest version
